translation: Nine Fascicle Section on the True Meaning of Śūraṃgama
○二四禪分(ii)
four meditations in one correct division (4)
three days of meditation at the beginning of the year (II)
one manifestation of the distinctive characteristics of the three heavens (3)
I Brahmadeva (Ānanda)
Second Heaven of the Attendants of Brahmā (desire for rebirth)
three great brahma heavens (body and mind)
Stopping the Contaminants by Binding Suffering (Ānanda)
three heavens of the second and second meditation (II)
one manifestation of the distinctive characteristics of the three heavens (3)

Two Heavens of Immeasurable Light (Luminosity)
Heaven of the Three Luminous Voices (Sukhāvatī)
Two Bonds of Sorrow and Freedom from Contamination (Ānanda)
three days of the third and third meditation (II)
one manifestation of the distinctive characteristics of the three heavens (3)
Yajñadatta (Ānanda)
two heavens of infinite purity (Jing Kong)
heaven (world) of samāpatti purity
The Second Conclusion of the Settlement of the Dharma (Ānanda)
nine heavens of the fourth and fourth meditation (II)
I.4. Vairocana (II)
I show the distinctive characteristics of the four celestials (3)
two days before the first indication (II)
one merit is born in heaven (Ānanda)
two heavens of blessedness (mind of indifference)
Two Judgments on the Two Gay Paths (Ānanda)
three manifestations of the latter two heavens (II)
one vast fruit-bearing heaven (if present)
two non-thought heavens (if present)
Dull Maturation of the Two Bonds of Immovability (Ānanda)
twenty-five heavens of the nonreturners (3)
One Standard for the Residence of the Sacred Fruits (Ānanda)
Two Illustrations of the Distinctive Characteristics of the Five Heavens (5)
one untroubled heaven (Ānanda)
two non-heating heavens (including the one with the capacity for enlightenment)
three good-looking celestials (in the ten directions)
four good manifesting celestials (Jingjian)
five-colored final heaven (final)
three bonds and four heavens not seen (Ānanda)
Two Bonds Belonging to the Form Sphere (Ānanda)
△The end of the second and fourth meditation [heavens]
○Three or Four Blank Marks (V)
I Biqi chusheng (furthermore)
two correct columns of four celestials (four)
heaven of infinite space (if it exists)
heaven of the infinite range of the two consciousnesses (all obstructions)
three heavens of no existence (emptiness and form)
four heavens of neither perception nor non-perception (consciousness nature)
three holy worldlings who have fallen (here)
four supernormal abilities of worldlings and sages (Ānanda)
five bonds of formlessness (Ānanda)
△One: The End of the Correct Listing of the Gods
○Two passages summarized above (all of these)
△There are six heavenly destinies
○7. The Portion of the Course of Cultivation (2)
A total number of names (repeatedly)
Two Distinct Consciousnesses Included in the Path (4)
one egg-born demon (if present)
taking in a human being in the second womb (if at all)
Three Transformations of the Heavenly Recollections (with modifications)
The Four Wet-Living Animals (Ānanda)
△After explaining the various destinies in detail
○Two Conclusions on False Encouragement to Abandon (3)
medicine for one illness and two (3)
One general list of deluded illnesses (Ānanda)
profound root of the disease in the second finger (Ānanda)
three medications can be removed (if attained)
Two delusions in regard to both sameness and distinction (Ānanda)
three correct exhortations to remove (3)
one desire to cultivate must be removed (you 勗)
two kinds of non-removal are bound to fall (incomplete)
three kinds of intensified self-acquisition (even though one desires it)
△Two Conclusions on False Exhortations to Abandon
○Three judgments of what is wrong and what is right (do this)
△One discusses the seven destinies of exhortation to leave in order to warn against drowning, and then ends it

source_sentence: ○二談五魔令辨以護墮落分(二)
translation: ○Two Discourses on the Five Māras that Enable Identification to Protect Against Falling Back (2)

source_sentence: 一無間自說五陰魔境(三)
translation: An Uninterrupted Self-explained Demonic Realm of the Five Aggregates (3)
I Prabhū Māra's Object Should Be Known (3)
to tell (someone) once and for all (that is)
to express one's views (II)
One has been explained (to you)
Two Subsequent Explanations Not Yet Explained (2)
one general indication of the evil (you are like)
II. Brief Explanation of Māra's Appearance (2)

source_sentence: 一略示前三內外魔相(或汝)
translation: One briefly shows the first three internal and external Māra appearances (or you)

source_sentence: 二略示後二心見魔相(又復)
translation: Second, it briefly shows the latter two views of Māra (and again)
three rules for listening and permitting explanations (should you)
The two assembled congregations paid homage to (Ānanda)

a marker that shows the reason for the activation (2)

one delusion, a false existence, and space (from you)
two kinds of worlds based on emptiness (transformation delusion)
the realm of emptiness is obscured in three comparisons (should be understood)
The four elements of the four refuges will surely destroy the realm of emptiness (for all of you)

definitely united with the holy flow (of you people)
two, all beings are disturbed (all)

one first removes the fallacy of error in regard to worldlings (worldlings)

four reasons for being disturbed (for this reason)

to refute the host with a parting of the guest (II)
a metaphorical guest is not harmful (yet it is)
two kinds of correct deduction of delusion from the master (accomplishment)

Once enlightened, one will surely surpass (3)
helplessness (in the present situation) that has been eliminated
two, it shows what it's about (the disappearance of the aggregates)
Three Summaries Must Be Expelled (How)
two kinds of delusion are bound to lead to ruin (if not)
three lifts of the former and a comparison of the shallow and the deep (2)
one indication of the shallowness of the harm caused by falling into sexual excess (like mo)
Second, it shows the depth of the harm caused by Māra (this is)

demonic aspects of the aggregate of a single color (3)
one set of instructions (II)
one who first cultivates the unbroken zone and the universe (3)

two modes of meditative equipoise (future abiding)
three samādhis (essences)
two final refutations of the manifestation of the false origin (if the eye)
ten intermediate (ten) objects in the second half of the day
one body is able to escape obstruction (Ānanda)

the three hearers of the sermon on emptiness (also by)
